metadata.title: CVE-2014-5165 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The dissect_ber_constrained_bitstring function inepan/dissectors/packet-ber.c in the ASN.1 BER dissector in Wireshark 1.10.xbefore 1.10.9 does not properly validate padding values, which allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (buffer underflow andapplication crash) via a crafted packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5165` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwireshark10 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwiretap7 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwscodecs1 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwsutil8 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
tshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-common - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-gtk - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-qt - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.12.1+g01b65bf-2').
